p: Aside from any anxiety about ‘reverse colonization’ via le grand remplacement (Camus 2011), the trigger is already in effect. Corporate agro-technologies are not about ‘food access’, and if further unleashed by the WEF’s ‘stakeholder capitalism’, they may well precipitate a mass exodus of over a billion rural peoples, undermining diversified farming systems that manage half the world’s land and three quarters of its fresh water and provide up to 70% of the world’s food (Cribb 2010).
